sen.j: 鞭懸（むちかけ）は、神明造で、棟の下、扠首竿（さすざお）の左右に当たって破風面から、左右4本ずつ突き出した、計8本の小さい木である。
sen.e: Muchikake is composed of eight small wooden members; four of them project to the left and the other four project to the right, from hafu (a barge board) located underneath of a ridge and beside the sasuzao (the diagonal braces used to form the triangular frame in many gable pediments) in the shinmei-zukuri style building.

Muchikake are composed of eight small wooden members, four of which project to the left and four of which project to the right, from the hafu (bargeboard) located underneath the ridge and beside the sasuzao (diagonal braces used to form the triangular frame in many gable pediments) on shinmei-zukuri style buildings.
sen.cmt: ・「;」→「,」・「is」→「are」・「them」→「which」・「the other four」→「four of which」・「the」を追加・「a barge board」→「bargeboard」・「of a」→「the」・「the」を削除・「in the shinmei-zukuri style building」→「on shinmei-zukuri style buildings」
sen.e: Muchikake are composed of eight small wooden members, four of which project to the left and four of which project to the right, from the hafu (bargeboard) located underneath the ridge and beside the sasuzao (diagonal braces used to form the triangular frame in many gable pediments) on shinmei-zukuri style buildings.

sen.j: 小狭小舞(おさごまい)とも「ひれい」ともいう。
sen.e: It is also called the osagomai or `hirei.'
It is also called the "osagomai" or "hirei".
It is also called the "osagomai" or "hirei."

sen.j: その根元のほうは四角形で、尖端は円形である。
sen.e: The end of Muchikake is in a square shape, and its top is in a round shape.
Muchikake are square at their inner ends, and circular toward their outer ends.
Muchikake are square at their inner ends, and circular toward their outer ends.

sen.j: 鞭懸という名称はこれに鞭を懸けたものであろうというのから出たとも、御饌料のイネ束などを懸けたものかともいうが、明確でない。
sen.e: There are a few theories regarding the origin of its name that are not confirmed; it is used for muchikake (hanging (kake) cane (muchi)); it is used for hanging a bundle of rice for mikeryo offering.

It has been suggested that the name "muchikake" originated because the pegs were used on which to hang whips (muchi), and it has also been said that they were used on which to hang bundles of rice for offerings to Shinto kami but it is not certain what they were used for.
sen.cmt: 分かりやすくように書き直し
sen.e: It has been suggested that the name "muchikake" originated because the pegs were used on which to hang whips (muchi), and it has also been said that they were used on which to hang bundles of rice for offerings to Shinto kami but it is not certain what they were used for.

sen.j: 神道では、天神地祇の風光、衆人の寿命、国の擁衛、人民の轡策であるなどという。
sen.e: According to the Shinto religion, it describes breeze and shine of the gods of heaven and earth, the lifetime of the whole company, defense of the country, and 轡策 of people.
sen.cmt: 轡策→読み方・文意ともに不明なため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: According to Shinto, they represent the wind and light of the gods of heaven and earth, the longevity of the people, the defense of the nation, and control over the public.
sen.cmt: 分かりやすくように書き直し
sen.e: According to Shinto, they represent the wind and light of the gods of heaven and earth, the longevity of the people, the defense of the nation, and control over the public.
